$$Component_Title: A human readable name for the component.
$$Component_Description: A description of the component including information about its function.
$$Component_Type: A category describing the purpose of the component. ALLOWED VALUES interconnection:software:hardware:service:physical:process-procedure:plan:guidance:standard:validation:
$$Rule_Id: A textual label that uniquely identifies a policy (desired state) that can be used to reference it elsewhere in this or other documents.
$$Rule_Description: A description of the policy (desired state) including information about its purpose and scope.
$Parameter_Id: A textual label that uniquely identifies the parameter associated with that policy (desired state) or controls implemented by the policy (desired state).
$Parameter_Description: A description of the parameter including the purpose and use of the parameter.
$Parameter_Value_Alternatives: ONLY for the policy (desired state) parameters: A value or set of values the parameter can take. The catalog parameters values are defined in the catalog.
$Parameter_Value_Default: A value recommended by Compliance Team in this profile for the parameter of the control or policy (desired state). If a CIS-benchmark exists, the default default could be the CIS-benchmark. recommanded value.
$$Profile_Source: A URL reference to the source catalog or profile for which this component is implementing controls for. A profile designates a selection and configuration of controls from one or more catalogs.
$$Control_Id_List: A list of textual labels that uniquely identify the controls or statements that the component implements.
$Check_Id: A textual label that uniquely identifies a check of the policy (desired state) that can be used to reference it elsewhere in this or other documents. (Provided by PVP)
$Check_Description: A description of the check of the policy (desired state) including the method (interview or examine or test) and procedure details. L2 owns the procedure description. (Provided by PVP)
$$Namespace: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name. Used in conjunction with "class" as the ontology concept.

$Parameter_Description: maximum number of authentication attempts permitted per connection
$$Profile_Description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 Sample Profile

$Parameter_Description: maximum number of concurrent unauthenticated connections to the SSH daemon
$$Profile_Description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 Sample Profile

$Parameter_Description: maximum number of open sessions permitted from a given connection
$$Profile_Description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 Sample Profile
